body:
What steps will reproduce the problem? When playing a duel between the premade decks "White Power" and "RG Rush 40", crashes are frequent (whoever plays which deck). I haven't experimented with using one deck but not the other in duels, but I've played plenty of crash-free duels that don't involve these decks at all. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Magarena 1.35, MacOS 10.8.2/10.8.3 Please provide any additional information below. I can't attach a crash.log for quota reasons, but the final error message is always:

Exception from controller.runGame: no artificial choice result
java.lang.RuntimeException: no artificial choice result
	at magic.model.choice.MagicChoice.getArtificialChoiceResults(MagicChoice.java:90)
	at magic.model.event.MagicEvent.getArtificialChoiceResults(MagicEvent.java:347)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:66)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:81)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:81)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:48)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:81)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:48)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.evaluateGame(ArtificialWorker.java:115)
	at magic.ai.MMAB$1.run(MMAB.java:165)

and the last few actions consistently tend to look something like:
452. MagicDrawAction = -322
453. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 1  ...) = 0
454. MagicExecuteFirstEventAction = 0
455. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 1  Play a card or ability.) = 0
456. MagicExecuteFirstEventAction = 0
457. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 0  Play a card or ability.) = 0
458. MagicExecuteFirstEventAction = 0
459. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 1  Play a card or ability.) = 0
author: [manve.he...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/107839499302741838633/)
title: Crash under OS X, seemingly deck-dependent
content:
_From [manve.he...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/107839499302741838633/) on March 26, 2013 08:34:43_

What steps will reproduce the problem? When playing a duel between the premade decks "White Power" and "RG Rush 40", crashes are frequent (whoever plays which deck). I haven't experimented with using one deck but not the other in duels, but I've played plenty of crash-free duels that don't involve these decks at all. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Magarena 1.35, MacOS 10.8.2/10.8.3 Please provide any additional information below. I can't attach a crash.log for quota reasons, but the final error message is always:

Exception from controller.runGame: no artificial choice result
java.lang.RuntimeException: no artificial choice result
	at magic.model.choice.MagicChoice.getArtificialChoiceResults(MagicChoice.java:90)
	at magic.model.event.MagicEvent.getArtificialChoiceResults(MagicEvent.java:347)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:66)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:81)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:81)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:48)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:81)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.runGame(ArtificialWorker.java:48)
	at magic.ai.ArtificialWorker.evaluateGame(ArtificialWorker.java:115)
	at magic.ai.MMAB$1.run(MMAB.java:165)

and the last few actions consistently tend to look something like:
452. MagicDrawAction = -322
453. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 1  ...) = 0
454. MagicExecuteFirstEventAction = 0
455. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 1  Play a card or ability.) = 0
456. MagicExecuteFirstEventAction = 0
457. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 0  Play a card or ability.) = 0
458. MagicExecuteFirstEventAction = 0
459. MagicAddEventAction (EVENT: 1  Play a card or ability.) = 0

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=338_
